page.title: 16PENNSYLVANIA, COLD ASHTON.
page.content: This{hamlet}about a mile from Cold Ashton, consists of 15 cottages of varying ages. One was used as a waggon works at one time.There are no main {drains,}mostly cesspits. The villagers are mainly middle to older age and have lived here all their lives. There are 2{farms}40% arable, 60% dairy. The two{public houses}both serve food. The Swan Inn in the middle of the hamlet has a children's play area. The White Hart is away from the hamlet on the A420. The only postbox is in the carpark of the Swan Inn. There is {a garage}mainly used as a filling station but doing a small amount of maintenance. It also sells sweets, cigarettes and snacks.For other shopping, there is a weekly free bus to a large shopping store.The{Cotswold {Way}long distance footpath passes through the hamlet.
